annotation_sentence: Yes, thank you. My name is Minji Lee. I am from Seoul. I study Business Administration at university. I, um, finished last year.
rationale: The noun 'Business Administration' and the verb 'study' form a collocation that expresses a complete and meaningful action.

annotation_sentence: Yes, we have group project. We make business plan for, um, new coffee shop. It was very exciting.
rationale: The noun 'business plan' and the verb 'make' form a collocation that expresses a complete and meaningful action.

annotation_sentence: I, um, I was leader. I organize meeting and, uh, make sure everyone do their part. Also, I present it in class.
rationale: The noun 'meeting' and the verb 'organize' form a collocation that expresses a complete and meaningful action.

annotation_sentence: We have problem with finance part. It was hard, but we ask professor for help and, um, research more. Finally, we find good solution.
rationale: The noun 'professor' and the verb 'ask' form a collocation that expresses a complete and meaningful action.

annotation_sentence: Yes, in university, we make, um, marketing plan for real company. Our plan was, uh, chosen by company, and they use it. It was great success.

annotation_sentence: I work on, um, research part and also help with presentation. I, uh, give idea for online campaign.
